rev.comment: updating, Canonical no longer requires the ownership/copyright of contributions
rev.diff:
Line 39: Line 39:
Further criticism concerns the choice of the patented [[mp3]] format for the music of the Ubuntu One Music Store and the unclear revenue share that will be granted to the community. The [[Amarok (software)|Amarok]] development team has announced that they will not add support for the Ubuntu One Music Store to the Amarok media player for the moment, unlike what they have done with [[Magnatune]] media store, which funds the project with 10% of the revenue produced via the interface to the store built in Amarok.{{citation needed|date=March 2011}}
Further criticism concerns the choice of the patented [[mp3]] format for the music of the Ubuntu One Music Store and the unclear revenue share that will be granted to the community. The [[Amarok (software)|Amarok]] development team has announced that they will not add support for the Ubuntu One Music Store to the Amarok media player for the moment, unlike what they have done with [[Magnatune]] media store, which funds the project with 10% of the revenue produced via the interface to the store built in Amarok.{{citation needed|date=March 2011}}
â   â
The source code and other material of the Ubuntu One project is subject to [[Canonical's contributor agreement]], requiring contributors to assign copyright to Canonical, and allowing Canonical to release it under a non-[[Open-source license|open source]] license.<ref name="main">{{cite web | url = http://www.canonical.com/contributors | accessdate = 2010-12-31 | title = Canonical's contributor agreement}}</ref> This agreement does not apply to the data of users of the Ubuntu One service.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://one.ubuntu.com/terms/ |title=Ubuntu One : Terms and Conditions|accessdate=2011-03-10}}</ref>
